thread.title: School trip to bird watching beauty spot called off after teacher finds three people DOGGING in hide
thread.title_full: School trip to bird watching beauty spot called off after teacher finds three people DOGGING in hide

author: Steve Robson
title: School trip to bird watching beauty spot called off after teacher finds three people DOGGING in hide
text:
News School trip to bird watching beauty spot called off after teacher finds three people DOGGING in hide The shocked member of staff found a couple brazenly romping at the RSPB wetlands area as a third man watched on Share Fairburn Ings Reserve (Photo: Google Street View) Share Get daily   
A school was forced to cancel a trip to a beauty spot after a teacher found three people DOGGING in a bird watching hide. 
The member of staff had been visiting Fairburn Ings reserve, an RSPB wetlands in Castleford, West Yorks., to see if it was suitable to bring schoolchildren. 
But as she arrived at one of the hides she found a couple romping inside and a third man watched on. 
The teacher told The Sun: "They were totally brazen. 
"They saw me but just smiled and carried on. 
"I was shocked." 
It is believed the wetlands have had frequent problems with people using the area for outdoor sex. 
An RSPB spokesman said: "We ask people to act in an appropriate way." Like us on Facebook
